required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Acute Effects of Different Macronutrient Compositions and Meal Distributions of the Food

brief_summary.textblock: Thirty participants without serious concomitant diseases consume either a high- or a low carb. meal either as one single meal or as 5 small portions in the morning and are tested for effects on major cardiovascular risk markers and on metabolic rate for three hours on each occasion.

detailed_description.textblock: Thirty participants come to the metabolic ward at about 8 o´clock in the fasting state and stay until lunch on four occasions each. The participants are randomized to the order of the test meals. The meals have a total caloric content of 750 kcal and have either 50% of energy from carbohydrates (low fat) or 20% of energy from carbohydrates (low carb.). The meals are consumed on one occasion in the morning or divided in 5 portions (150 kcal each) for every 30 minutes, i.e. total combinations of meal composition and of meal distribution is 4. Effects of the food on p-glucose, s-insulin, blood-lipids, hormones and on metabolic rate is measured by blood tests or by indirect calorimetry (for metabolic rate). Sense of satiety is measured by visual analogue scales.

primary_outcome.description: The metabolic rate is measured before (baseline) and there after repeatedly during 3 hours

secondary_outcome.description: Repeated test of glucose and insulin for three hours after test meal

arm_group.description: Intervention: One meal of 750 kcal with 20 % of energy content from carbohydrates
Intervention: Five meals every 30 minutes of 150 kcal/each with 20 % of energy content from carbohydrates.
Intervention: One meal of 750 kcal with 50 % of energy content from carbohydrates
Intervention: Five meals every 30 minutes of 150 kcal/each with 50 % of energy content from carbohydrates.

intervention.intervention_name: two test meals with two different macronutrient compositions
intervention.description: Either a high or a low carb meal either as one large or as 5 small meals. ie a crossover trial with one arm

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy participants > 18 years with or without obesity
Exclusion Criteria:
- Major illnesses,
- thyroid diseases,
- need to take prednisolone,
- psychiatric disease,
- inability to understand Swedish

overall_official.affiliation: Faculty of Medicine and Health Science, Linköping University, Sweden
